newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia's NSW caps off big grain harvest.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia's NSW caps off big grain harvest.

text.p: Grain receivals in the Australian state of New South Wales (NSW) had slowed since Christmas, bringing to an end the state's largest harvest on record, grain handling cooperative GrainCorp Ltd said on Tuesday.
So far GrainCorp had received 8.14 million tonnes of grain and continued to receive 5,000 tonnes a day, it said in its latest harvest diary.
Late receivals over coming months should see the previous record of 8.3 million tonnes of grain received in 1983/94 exceeded, it said.
Tom Keene, GrainCorp managing director, said the record was expected to only narrowly eclipsed.
GrainCorp estimated an additional one million tonnes of grain was stored on-farm, which, combined with receivals, would mean a state grain harvest of more than nine million tonnes, a likely record.
This year GrainCorp would undertake its largest export programme ever, with monthly exports of more than 500,000 tonnes to meet a six million tonne export programme.
This would involve three to four trains a day delivering to the port of Newcastle and five to seven trains a day delivering to Port Kembla, north and south of Sydney respectively.
Since October 1 last year, more than two million tonnes of grain had been moved by rail to port terminals and domestic users, GrainCorp said. Of this, 1.5 million tonnes was new season grain.
NSW grain receivals to January 13, tonnes
